      • genBoard

        public static java.lang.String[][] genBoard()
        Generate an initial board
        Returns:
        a 3x3 String[][] array with each element set to a single blank string (" ").

      • verifyValidPlayer

        public static void verifyValidPlayer(java.lang.String player)
        Check that the specified player is "x" or "o" and throw an IllegalArgumentException if it is not.
        Parameters:
        player - should be "x" or "o"

      • verifyValidRow

        Parameters:

      • prettyString

        public static java.lang.String prettyString(java.lang.String[][] board)
        Returns a standard view of the current board
        Parameters:
        board - the current 3x3 tic tac toe board
        Returns:
        a String that looks like a tic tac toe board

      • makeMove

        public static boolean makeMove(java.lang.String player,
                               java.lang.String[][] board,
                               int row,
                               int col)
        Record a move of the player at the row and column. You must
        • Make sure the player is valid (call verifyValidPlayer(java.lang.String))
        • Make sure the row and column are valid (call verifyValidRow(int) and verifyValidCol(int))
        • Make sure the board has no move at the row and column. In other words, it should have just a single space there. If the board already has a move there, return false.
        • Record the move at the row and column by storing the player String at board[row][col], and return true.
        Parameters:
        player - an "x" or an "o"
        board - a 3x3 String[][] array
        row - an integer between 0 and 2 inclusively
        col - an integer between 0 and 2 inclusively
        Returns:
        true iff the move was successful

      • boardFull

        public static boolean boardFull(java.lang.String[][] board)
        Is the board completely full of x and o moves?
        Parameters:
        board - a 3x3 String[][] array
        Returns:
        true iff the board is full

      • winFor

        public static boolean winFor(java.lang.String player,
                             java.lang.String[][] board)
        Does the board contain a win for the player? If it does, this method must return true even if the board also contains a win for the other player.
        Parameters:
        player - An "x" or "o". Any other input should throw an IllegalArgumentException
        board - A 3x3 String[][] array
        Returns:
        true iff the board contains some win for the specified player
